entry.title: Yidadaa/ChatGPT-Next-Web
entry.summary:
ä¸€é”®æ‹¥æœ‰ä½ è‡ªå·±çš„ ChatGPT ç½‘é¡µæœåŠ¡ã€‚ One-Click to deploy your own ChatGPT web UI.

ChatGPT Next Web

ä¸€é”®å…è´¹éƒ¨ç½²ä½ çš„ç§äºº ChatGPT ç½‘é¡µåº”ç”¨ã€‚

One-Click to deploy your own ChatGPT web UI.

æ¼”ç¤º Demo / åé¦ˆ Issues / åŠ å…¥ Discord / å¾®ä¿¡ç¾¤ / æ‰“èµå¼€å‘è€…

ä¸»è¦åŠŸèƒ½

  • åœ¨ 1 åˆ†é’Ÿå†…ä½¿ç”¨ Vercel å…è´¹ä¸€é”®éƒ¨ç½²
  • ç²¾å¿ƒè®¾è®¡çš„ UIï¼Œå“åº”å¼è®¾è®¡ï¼Œæ”¯æŒæ·±è‰²æ¨¡å¼
  • æå¿«çš„é¦–å±åŠ è½½é€Ÿåº¦ï¼ˆ~85kbï¼‰
  • è‡ªåŠ¨å‹ç¼©ä¸Šä¸‹æ–‡èŠå¤©è®°å½•ï¼Œåœ¨èŠ‚çœ Token çš„åŒæ—¶æ”¯æŒè¶…é•¿å¯¹è¯
  • ä¸€é”®å¯¼å‡ºèŠå¤©è®°å½•ï¼Œå®Œæ•´çš„ Markdown æ”¯æŒ
  • æ‹¥æœ‰è‡ªå·±çš„åŸŸåï¼Ÿå¥½ä¸ŠåŠ å¥½ï¼Œç»‘å®šåå³å¯åœ¨ä»»ä½•åœ°æ–¹æ— éšœç¢å¿«é€Ÿè®¿é—®

Features

  • Deploy for free with one-click on Vercel in under 1 minute
  • Responsive design, and dark mode
  • Fast first screen loading speed (~85kb)
  • Automatically compresses chat history to support long conversations while also saving your tokens
  • One-click export all chat history with full Markdown support

ä½¿ç”¨

  1. å‡†å¤‡å¥½ä½ çš„ OpenAI API Key;
  2. ç‚¹å‡»å³ä¾§æŒ‰é’®å¼€å§‹éƒ¨ç½²ï¼š ï¼Œç›´æ¥ä½¿ç”¨ Github è´¦å·ç™»é™†å³å¯ï¼Œè®°å¾—åœ¨ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡é¡µå¡«å…¥ API Keyï¼›
  3. éƒ¨ç½²å®Œæ¯•åï¼Œå³å¯å¼€å§‹ä½¿ç”¨ï¼›
  4. ï¼ˆå¯é€‰ï¼‰ç»‘å®šè‡ªå®šä¹‰åŸŸåï¼šVercel åˆ†é…çš„åŸŸå DNS åœ¨æŸäº›åŒºåŸŸè¢«æ±¡æŸ“äº†ï¼Œç»‘å®šè‡ªå®šä¹‰åŸŸåå³å¯ç›´è¿ã€‚

Get Started

  1. Get OpenAI API Key;
  2. Click ;
  3. Enjoy :)

ä¿æŒæ›´æ–° Keep Updated

å¦‚æœä½ æŒ‰ç…§ä¸Šè¿°æ­¥éª¤ä¸€é”®éƒ¨ç½²äº†è‡ªå·±çš„é¡¹ç›®ï¼Œå¯èƒ½ä¼šå‘ç°æ€»æ˜¯æç¤ºâ€œå­˜åœ¨æ›´æ–°â€çš„é—®é¢˜ï¼Œè¿™æ˜¯ç”±äº Vercel ä¼šé»˜è®¤ä¸ºä½ åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªæ–°é¡¹ç›®è€Œä¸æ˜¯ fork æœ¬é¡¹ç›®ï¼Œè¿™ä¼šå¯¼è‡´æ— æ³•æ­£ç¡®åœ°æ£€æµ‹æ›´æ–°ã€‚ æ¨èä½ æŒ‰ç…§ä¸‹åˆ—æ­¥éª¤é‡æ–°éƒ¨ç½²ï¼š

  • åˆ é™¤æ‰åŸå…ˆçš„ repoï¼›
  • fork æœ¬é¡¹ç›®ï¼›
  • å‰å¾€ vercel æ§åˆ¶å°ï¼Œåˆ é™¤æ‰åŸå…ˆçš„ projectï¼Œç„¶åæ–°å»º projectï¼Œé€‰æ‹©ä½ åˆšåˆš fork å‡ºæ¥çš„é¡¹ç›®é‡æ–°è¿›è¡Œéƒ¨ç½²å³å¯ï¼›
  • åœ¨é‡æ–°éƒ¨ç½²çš„è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­ï¼Œè¯·æ‰‹åŠ¨æ·»åŠ åä¸º OPENAI_API_KEY çš„ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡ï¼Œå¹¶å¡«å…¥ä½ çš„ api key ä½œä¸ºå€¼ã€‚

æœ¬é¡¹ç›®ä¼šæŒç»­æ›´æ–°ï¼Œå¦‚æœä½ æƒ³è®©ä»£ç åº“æ€»æ˜¯ä¿æŒæ›´æ–°ï¼Œå¯ä»¥æŸ¥çœ‹ Github çš„æ–‡æ¡£ äº†è§£å¦‚ä½•è®© fork çš„é¡¹ç›®ä¸ä¸Šæ¸¸ä»£ç åŒæ­¥ï¼Œå»ºè®®å®šæœŸè¿›è¡ŒåŒæ­¥æ“ä½œä»¥è·å¾—æ–°åŠŸèƒ½ã€‚

ä½ å¯ä»¥ star/watch æœ¬é¡¹ç›®æˆ–è€… follow ä½œè€…æ¥åŠæ—¶è·å¾—æ–°åŠŸèƒ½æ›´æ–°é€šçŸ¥ã€‚

If you have deployed your own project with just one click following the steps above, you may encounter the issue of "Updates Available" constantly showing up. This is because Vercel will create a new project for you by default instead of forking this project, resulting in the inability to detect updates correctly.

We recommend that you follow the steps below to re-deploy:

  • Delete the original repo;
  • Fork this project;
  • Go to the Vercel dashboard, delete the original project, then create a new project and select the project you just forked to redeploy;
  • Please manually add an environment variable named OPENAI_API_KEY and enter your API key as the value during the redeploy process.

This project will be continuously maintained. If you want to keep the code repository up to date, you can check out the Github documentation to learn how to synchronize a forked project with upstream code. It is recommended to perform synchronization operations regularly.

You can star or watch this project or follow author to get release notifictions in time.

è®¿é—®æ§åˆ¶ Access Control

æœ¬é¡¹ç›®æä¾›æœ‰é™çš„æƒé™æ§åˆ¶åŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œè¯·åœ¨ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡é¡µå¢åŠ åä¸º CODE çš„ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡ï¼Œå€¼ä¸ºç”¨è‹±æ–‡é€—å·åˆ†éš”çš„è‡ªå®šä¹‰æ§åˆ¶ç ï¼š

code1,code2,code3

å¢åŠ æˆ–ä¿®æ”¹è¯¥ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡åï¼Œè¯·é‡æ–°éƒ¨ç½²é¡¹ç›®ä½¿æ”¹åŠ¨ç”Ÿæ•ˆã€‚

This project provides limited access control. Please add an environment variable named CODE on the environment variables page. The value should be a custom control code separated by comma like this:

code1,code2,code3

After adding or modifying this environment variable, please redeploy the project for the changes to take effect.

å¼€å‘ Development

ç‚¹å‡»ä¸‹æ–¹æŒ‰é’®ï¼Œå¼€å§‹äºŒæ¬¡å¼€å‘ï¼š

åœ¨å¼€å§‹å†™ä»£ç ä¹‹å‰ï¼Œéœ€è¦åœ¨é¡¹ç›®æ ¹ç›®å½•æ–°å»ºä¸€ä¸ª .env.local æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œé‡Œé¢å¡«å…¥ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡ï¼š

Before starting development, you must create a new .env.local file at project root, and place your api key into it:

OPENAI_API_KEY=<your api key here>

æœ¬åœ°å¼€å‘ Local Development

å¦‚æœä½ æ˜¯ä¸­å›½å¤§é™†ç”¨æˆ·ï¼Œä¸å»ºè®®åœ¨æœ¬åœ°è¿›è¡Œå¼€å‘ï¼Œé™¤éä½ èƒ½å¤Ÿç‹¬ç«‹è§£å†³ OpenAI API æœ¬åœ°ä»£ç†é—®é¢˜ã€‚

  1. å®‰è£… nodejs å’Œ yarnï¼Œå…·ä½“ç»†èŠ‚è¯·è¯¢é—® ChatGPTï¼›
  2. æ‰§è¡Œ yarn install && yarn dev å³å¯ã€‚

æœ¬åœ°éƒ¨ç½² Local Deployment

è¯·ç›´æ¥è¯¢é—® ChatGPTï¼Œä½¿ç”¨ä¸‹åˆ— Promptï¼š

å¦‚ä½•ä½¿ç”¨ pm2 å’Œ yarn éƒ¨ç½² nextjs é¡¹ç›®åˆ° ubuntu æœåŠ¡å™¨ä¸Šï¼Œé¡¹ç›®ç¼–è¯‘å‘½ä»¤ä¸º yarn buildï¼Œå¯åŠ¨å‘½ä»¤ä¸º yarn startï¼Œå¯åŠ¨æ—¶éœ€è¦è®¾ç½®ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡ä¸º OPENAI_API_KEYï¼Œç«¯å£ä¸º 3000ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨ ngnix åšåå‘ä»£ç†

Please ask ChatGPT with prompt:

how to deploy nextjs project with pm2 and yarn on my ubuntu server, the build command is `yarn build`, the start command is `yarn start`, the project must start with env var named `OPENAI_API_KEY`, the port is 3000, use ngnix

Docker Deployment

è¯·ç›´æ¥è¯¢é—® ChatGPTï¼Œä½¿ç”¨ä¸‹åˆ— Promptï¼š

å¦‚ä½•ä½¿ç”¨ docker éƒ¨ç½² nextjs é¡¹ç›®åˆ° ubuntu æœåŠ¡å™¨ä¸Šï¼Œé¡¹ç›®ç¼–è¯‘å‘½ä»¤ä¸º yarn buildï¼Œå¯åŠ¨å‘½ä»¤ä¸º yarn startï¼Œå¯åŠ¨æ—¶éœ€è¦è®¾ç½®ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡ä¸º OPENAI_API_KEYï¼Œç«¯å£ä¸º 3000ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨ ngnix åšåå‘ä»£ç†

Please ask ChatGPT with prompt:

how to deploy nextjs project with docker on my ubuntu server, the build command is `yarn build`, the start command is `yarn start`, the project must start with env var named `OPENAI_API_KEY`, the port is 3000, use ngnix

æˆªå›¾ Screenshots

è¯´æ˜ Attention

æœ¬é¡¹ç›®çš„æ¼”ç¤ºåœ°å€æ‰€ç”¨çš„ OpenAI è´¦æˆ·çš„å…è´¹é¢åº¦å°†äº 2023-04-01 è¿‡æœŸï¼Œå±Šæ—¶å°†æ— æ³•é€šè¿‡æ¼”ç¤ºåœ°å€åœ¨çº¿ä½“éªŒã€‚

å¦‚æœä½ æƒ³è´¡çŒ®å‡ºè‡ªå·±çš„ API Keyï¼Œå¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡ä½œè€…ä¸»é¡µçš„é‚®ç®±å‘é€ç»™ä½œè€…ï¼Œå¹¶æ ‡æ³¨è¿‡æœŸæ—¶é—´ã€‚

The free trial of the OpenAI account used by the demo will expire on April 1, 2023, and the demo will not be available at that time.

If you would like to contribute your API key, you can email it to the author and indicate the expiration date of the API key.

é¸£è°¢ Special Thanks

ãƒ»Mac ç‰ˆã¯ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’è§£å‡ã—ãŸã®ã¡ã«ã€ä½¿ç”¨ã™ã‚‹ VC ã«å¿œã˜ãŸstartHttp_xxx.commandã‚’ãƒ€ãƒ–ãƒ«ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚é–‹ç™ºå…ƒã‚’æ¤œè¨¼ã§ããªã„æ—¨ãŒç¤ºã•ã‚Œã‚‹å ´åˆã¯ã€å†åº¦ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‚­ãƒ¼ã‚’æŠ¼ã—ã¦ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ã—ã¦å®Ÿè¡Œã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„(or å³ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ã‹ã‚‰å®Ÿè¡Œã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„)ã€‚ï¼ˆè©³ç´°ä¸‹è¨˜ *1ï¼‰

entry.title: vincanger/coverlettergpt
entry.summary:
Generate Cover Letters based on Job Description and your ResumÃ©. Manage jobs and applications. Get Hired. Have fun. Be cool. Go to School.

CoverLetterGPT.xyz

Running it locally

After cloning this repo, you can run it locally by following these steps:

  1. Install Wasp by running curl -sSL https://get.wasp-lang.dev/installer.sh | sh in your terminal.
  2. Create a .env.server file in the root of the project
  3. Copy the env.example file contents to .env.server and fill in your API keys
  4. Run wasp db migrate-dev
  5. Run wasp start
  6. Go to localhost:3000 in your browser (your NodeJS server will be running on port 3001)

How it works

coverlettergpt.xyz was built in a couple of days using a few really cool tools:

  • ğŸ Wasp - allows you to build full-stack apps with 10x less boilerplate
  • ğŸ¨ Chakra-ui - UI components for React that look good and are easy to work with
  • ğŸ¤– OpenAI - GPT-3.5 turbo API
  • ğŸ’¸ Stripe - for tip payments

Wasp as the full-stack framework allows you to describe your appâ€™s core features in the main.wasp config file in the root directory. Then it builds and glues these features into a React-Express-Prisma app for you so that you can focus on writing the client and server-side logic instead of configuring. For example, I did not have to use any third-party libraries for Google Authentication. I just wrote a couple lines of code in the config file stating that I want to use Google Auth, and Wasp configures it for me. Check out the main.wasp file for more.

Also, Chakra-ui is great for building nice looking UIâ€™s really quickly and easily. Some people are turned off by the fact that theyâ€™re React components, but I find that theyâ€™re easy to customize and configure, and get me started on designs 10x faster and with less code than tailwind.

For more info on the prompts and configuration I used for the OpenAI API, check out the src/server/actions.ts file.

Stripe makes the payment functionality super easy. I just used their Pre-configured Checkout feature on a one-time purchase product. After the user pays, I update their hasPaid and datePaid fields in the database. Then I use Wasp's integrated Jobs feature to run a cron job that checks if 3 months has passed since paying, and if so, it sets hasPaid to false again.

I also implemented a cron job to send an email to the user to notify them 2 weeks before their subscription ends. I used SendGrid for the email service.

If you have any other questions, feel free to reach out to me on twitter
